definition: modulation (rising and falling pitch)/intonation/a cadence/to rise and fall (of a body floating in water)
to restrain/to restrict/to keep down/or
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
iambic
cadence/modulation

sentences.english: In a poem, cadences are arranged in regular sequence.
sentences.chinese: 在一首诗里，抑扬顿挫是按一定顺序配置的。

sentences.english: Blank verse is unrhymed iambic pentameter.
sentences.chinese: 无韵诗是不押韵的抑扬格五步格诗。

sentences.english: Tibetan folk song cadence, rhyme Hezhe paste, attractive.
sentences.chinese: 藏族民歌抑扬顿挫，合辙贴韵，悦耳动听。

sentences.english: We use a circumflex to indicate an operator.
sentences.chinese: 我们用抑扬符表示一算符。

sentences.english: It was written in rhyming couplets of iambic pentameter.
sentences.chinese: 全诗是用五步抑扬格对偶句式写的。

sentences.english: Cantabile years of time walking and cadence.
sentences.chinese: 如歌岁月因时间的行走而抑扬顿挫。

sentences.english: A couplet written in iambic pentameter is called a heroic couplet.
sentences.chinese: 五步抑扬格的双韵体称英雄双韵体。

sentences.english: Her voice had a soft Welsh lilt to it.
sentences.chinese: 她讲话的声音柔和而抑扬顿挫，有些威尔士口音。
节奏完全按四音步句的抑扬格在行进。

sentences.english: The most standard of these is the iamb.
You don't know what I'm saying if I say it in a flat tone.
sentences.chinese: 如果我说话没有抑扬顿挫，你也不会明白我在说什么。

sentences.english: Melody refer to the voice of the original cadence, is a spiritual experience.
sentences.chinese: 韵原来是指声音的抑扬顿挫，是一种心灵的感受。

sentences.english: He read the poems with cadence.
sentences.chinese: 他抑扬顿挫地朗诵诗歌。

sentences.english: How many of you know what iambic pentameter is?
sentences.chinese: 你们有多少人知道抑扬格的五音步格诗？

sentences.english: His recitation was cadenced and rich in feeling .
sentences.chinese: 他的朗颂抑扬顿挫，富有感情。

sentences.english: Churchill's cadences began to roll out of the short-wave radio .
sentences.chinese: 短波电台里开始传出邱吉尔那抑扬顿挫的声调。

definition: see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
see 一倡三歎|一倡三叹[yi1 chang4 san1 tan4]
cadence/modulation
music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
sinuous/meandering/to take a circuitous route/to toss about/vicissitudes/variant of 婉轉|婉转[wan3 zhuan3]
cadence/rhythm/rhyme scheme/meter (in verse)/(linguistics) prosody
rhyme and tone/intonation
intense/loud
musical note/tone
(voice, music) suave/mellow/(speech) indirect/tactful
lit. as if weeping and complaining (idiom)/fig. mournful (music or singing)
reverberates around the rafters (idiom); fig. sonorous and resounding (esp. of singing voice)
level and oblique tones (technical term for Classical Chinese rhythmic poetry)
a transition (stop and change) in spoken sound, music or in brush strokes/a cadence/punctuated by a transition/with syncopated cadence (brush stroke in painting)
tune/melody
soul-stirring (of drama, poem or artwork)/heart-rending/deeply moving
